p: Our previous study in lambs infected with the gastrointestinal nematode H. contortus indicate the anthelmintic potential of the medicinal herbs and zinc due to a reduction in the fecal egg count and abomasal worm burden; in addition, the clinical signs of haemonchosis, such as anemia, were improved by treatment. However, no significant effects on body weight and mean live-weight gain of infected lambs were observed throughout the experiment due to Hmix and/or Zn treatment [ 22].
